messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>On 9/10/06, Michael Feathers <mfeathers@...> wrote:
>
>
>>I was thinking about this last night and I realized that you can mock
>>System by creating your own:
>>
>>
>
>
>If the code under test can be modified, there are many ways to test it, so
>it's not very interesting to me :-)
>
>A more interesting scenario is when that code cannot be modified, and in
>this case, I can only think of two ways to test it:
>
> - Use a security manager, as I explained before.
> - Write your own java.lang.System and put it on the bootclasspath
> before running the tests.
>
>Can anyone think of other ways?
>
>
>
Seems like the security manager has that issue with the return code
though, doesn't it?

Yes, it's interesting to think about what to do when the code can't be
changed... a fun design challenge, but I'm glad that most of the time
the code can be changed and it's the right thing to do.

Michael Feathers
www.objectmentor.com
